techmeme.title: Amazon says it is closing its Wondery podcast studio and will break up its operations as part of a broad reorganization; a source says ~110 jobs will be cut (Bloomberg)
Spotify says it is updating prices across South Asia, the Middle East, Africa, Europe, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific; an example email had a €1/month rise (Olivia Solon/Bloomberg)
Connecticut-based Amphenol plans to acquire North Carolina-based CommScope's broadband connectivity and cable unit for ~$10.5B, including debt, amid the AI boom (Lauren Thomas/Wall Street Journal)
Bullish, a digital asset exchange and CoinDesk owner, plans to sell 20.3M shares at $28 to $31 in a US IPO, raising up to $629.3M at an up to $4.2B valuation (Monique Mulima/Bloomberg)
Lyft partners with Baidu to launch autonomous vehicles in Germany and the UK in 2026, pending regulatory approval; Lyft will deploy Baidu's sixth-gen robotaxis (Natalie Lung/Bloomberg)
